t: Luke 24
The Resurrection
But*p on the first day of the week, at early dawn, they came to the tomb bringing the spices which they had prepared.
And they found the stone rolled away from the tomb,
but when they entered, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.
While they were perplexed about this, behold, two men suddenly stood near them in dazzling clothing;
and as the*i women*i were terrified and bowed their faces to the ground, the*i men*i said to them, “Why do you seek the living One among the dead?
He is not here, but He has risen. Remember how He spoke to you while He was still in Galilee,
saying that the Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.”
And they remembered His words,
and returned from the tomb and reported all these things to the eleven and to all the rest.
Now they were Mary Magdalene and Joanna and Mary the mother*i of James; also the other women with them were telling these things to the apostles.
But these words appeared to them as nonsense, and they would not believe them.
But Peter got up and ran to the tomb; stooping and looking in, he saw the linen wrappings only; and he went away to his home, marveling at what had happened.
The Road to Emmaus
And*p behold, two of them were going that very day to a village named Emmaus, which was about seven miles from Jerusalem.
And they were talking with each other about all these things which had taken place.
While they were talking and discussing, Jesus Himself approached and began*i traveling with them.
But their eyes were prevented from recognizing Him.
And He said to them, “What*r are*r these*r words*r that*r you*r are*r exchanging*r with*r one*r another*r as*r you*r are*r walking?”*r And they stood still, looking sad.
One of*i them,*i named Cleopas, answered and said to Him, “Are You the only one visiting Jerusalem and unaware of the things which have happened here in these days?”
And He said to them, “What*r things?”*r And they said to Him, “The things about Jesus the Nazarene, who was a prophet mighty in deed and word in the sight of God and all the people,
and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered Him to the sentence of death, and crucified Him.
But we were hoping that it was He who was going to redeem Israel. Indeed, besides all this, it is the third day since these things happened.
But also some women among us amazed us. When they were at the tomb early in the morning,
and did not find His body, they came, saying that they had also seen a vision of angels who said that He was alive.
Some of those who were with us went to the tomb and found it just exactly as the women also had said; but Him they did not see.”
And He said to them, “O*r foolish*r men*r and*r slow*r of*r heart*r to*r believe*r in*r all*r that*r the*r prophets*r have*r spoken!*r
Was*r it*r not*r necessary*r for*r the*r Christ*r to*r suffer*r these*r things*r and*r to*r enter*r into*r His*r glory?”*r
Then beginning with Moses and with all the prophets, He explained to them the things concerning Himself in all the Scriptures.
And*p they approached the village where they were going, and He acted as though He were going farther.
But they urged Him, saying, “Stay with us, for it is getting*i toward evening, and the day is now nearly over.” So He went in to stay with them.
When He had reclined at*i the*i table*i with them, He took the bread and blessed it,*i and breaking it,*i He began*i giving it*i to them.
Then their eyes were opened and they recognized Him; and He vanished from their sight.
They said to one another, “Were not our hearts burning within us while He was speaking to us on the road, while He was explaining the Scriptures to us?”
And they got up that very hour and returned to Jerusalem, and found gathered together the eleven and those who were with them,
saying, “The Lord has really risen and has appeared to Simon.”
They began*i to relate their experiences on the road and how He was recognized by them in the breaking of the bread.
Other Appearances
While*p they were telling these things, He Himself stood in their midst and said to them, “Peace*r be*r to*r you.”*r
But they were startled and frightened and thought that they were seeing a spirit.
And He said to them, “Why*r are*r you*r troubled,*r and*r why*r do*r doubts*r arise*r in*r your*r hearts?*r
See*r My*r hands*r and*r My*r feet,*r that*r it*r is*r I*r Myself;*r touch*r Me*r and*r see,*r for*r a*r spirit*r does*r not*r have*r flesh*r and*r bones*r as*r you*r see*r that*r I*r have.”*r
And when He had said this, He showed them His hands and His feet.
While they still could not believe it*i because of their joy and amazement, He said to them, “Have*r you*r anything*r here*r to*r eat?”*r
They gave Him a piece of a broiled fish;
and He took it and ate it*i before them.

Now*p He said to them, “These*r are*r My*r words*r which*r I*r spoke*r to*r you*r while*r I*r was*r still*r with*r you,*r that*r all*r things*r which*r are*r written*r about*r Me*r in*r the*r Law*r of*r Moses*r and*r the*r Prophets*r and*r the*r Psalms*r must*r be*r fulfilled.”*r
Then He opened their minds to understand the Scriptures,
and He said to them, “Thus*r it*r is*r written,*r that*r the*r Christ*r would*r suffer*r and*r rise*r again*r from*r the*r dead*r the*r third*r day,*r
and*r that*r repentance*r for*r forgiveness*r of*r sins*r would*r be*r proclaimed*r in*r His*r name*r to*r all*r the*r nations,*r beginning*r from*r Jerusalem.*r
You*r are*r witnesses*r of*r these*r things.*r

And*r behold,*r I*r am*r sending*r forth*r the*r promise*r of*r My*r Father*r upon*r you;*r but*r you*r are*r to*r stay*r in*r the*r city*r until*r you*r are*r clothed*r with*r power*r from*r on*r high.”*r
The Ascension
And*p He led them out as far as Bethany, and He lifted up His hands and blessed them.
While He was blessing them, He parted from them and was carried up into heaven.
And they, after worshiping Him, returned to Jerusalem with great joy,
and were continually in the temple praising God.
